senses.sense_definition: The branch of science concerned with the chemical and physicochemical processes and substances that occur within living organisms.

examples.text: My aunt has a degree in <w>biochemistry</w>.
He decided to study <w>biochemistry</w> to understand how cells function.

senses.sense_definition: The specific chemical characteristics, composition, and processes of a particular living organism.

examples.text: The <w>biochemistries</w> of fungal and bacterial cells are quite distinct.
Doctors must understand human <w>biochemistry</w> to treat metabolic diseases effectively.

senses.sense_definition: The biochemical activity or processes associated with a particular chemical, disease, or condition.

examples.text: Our study compared the <w>biochemistries</w> of epilepsy and Parkinson's disease.
Researchers are still investigating the complex <w>biochemistry</w> of the brain.
